result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian L McThadden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and DNA  as follows: Defendant to perform 40 hours of community service to offset the fines and costs. ($10.00 an hour)
To be done within 1 year.
AMENDED 12-15-2015:  Defendant has provided proof of 40 hours of community service.  Court costs have been amended down to $53 owed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian L McThadden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From Atty Buttery dated 12/12/15 requesting fines/costs be reduced due to completion of community service.  Letter of confirmation attached.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Adrian L McThadden in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- 3 days jail - credit for 3 days. Court orders time served.
- Court Costs of $253.00 (includes DRGOD). Defendant to perform 40 hours of community at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the fines and costs. 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - append to court costs 
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Adrian L McThadden did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense has received an amended offer and requests a plea/sentencing date within the next 30 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Adrian L McThadden did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court forfeits and revokes bail and issues a capias. Case recalled. Defendant is now present. Defense addresses discovery. Court will give another date in 30 days. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Adrian L McThadden did not appear.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with the co-actor, victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Adrian L McThadden in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
